snippet: Fructose consumption may increase cardiovascular risk factors because it increases visceral fat, the kind that accumulates around internal organs.
abstract: Study by Norman K Pollock published in The Journal of Nutrition finds fructose consumption, largely from high-fructose corn syrup, may increase cardiovascular risk factors because it increases visceral fat, the type that accumulates around internal organs.
lead_paragraph: Fructose consumption may increase cardiovascular risk factors because it increases visceral fat, the kind that accumulates around internal organs.

headline.seo: Fructose Consumption Increases Visceral Fat, Study Reports
headline.main: Risks: Fructose Intake Is Linked to Visceral Fat
headline.print_headline: Risks: Fructose Intake Is Linked to Visceral Fat
